title: SpaceX rapidly reuses converted Falcon Heavy booster
summary: SpaceX has reflown a converted Falcon Heavy side booster just 37 days after its first mission as a Falcon 9 rocket, successfully...

title: Voters block agreement for planned Georgia spaceport
summary: Voters in a Georgia county have dealt a potentially fatal blow to a proposed spaceport, a move that may provide lessons for other prospective spaceports.

title: UK bans space-related exports to Russia
summary: New trade sanctions aimed at Russia’s space sector were announced March 9 by UK Foreign Secretary Liz Truss.

title: Canada answers Ukraine’s call for satellite radar imagery
summary: Canada’s MDA Corp. will provide satellite radar imagery to Ukraine’s government to help it counter Russia’s invasion of that country. Canadian government sources say that RADARSAT-2 will be used to collect the data.

title: Congress finally delivers a budget, and NASA gets most of what it wants
summary: Congress's favorite rocket, of course, got extra funding, while science did not.

title: Omnibus spending bill includes $24 billion for NASA for 2022
summary: House and Senate appropriators completed work March 9 on an omnibus spending bill for fiscal year 2022 that would give NASA a little more than $24 billion, $760 million below the administration’s request.

title: SpaceX “broomstick” launches 40th Starlink mission
summary: Another grouping of 48 Starlink internet satellites soared into orbit Wednesday from Cape Canaveral aboard a Falcon 9 rocket, or what SpaceX’s launch director jokingly called an “American broomstick” in a jab at Russian space chief Dmitry Rogozin.

title: Schedule tight for June launch of first Momentus tug
summary: In-space transportation company Momentus says it is making good progress toward the first launch of its Vigoride space tug, but that the schedule is “tight” for a launch in June.

title: Space programs moving up on DoD’s budget priority list
summary: Pentagon funding for space programs will grow in the coming years as the U.S. military increasingly relies on satellites to conduct operations, the Defense Department’s comptroller Mike McCord said March 9.

title: SatixFy to go public through latest space SPAC deal
summary: Satellite communications equipment maker SatixFy said March 8 it has agreed to go public by merging with a special purpose acquisition company, shrugging off market uncertainty that helped dash weather startup Tomorrow.io’s SPAC plans the day before.
